citation.article-title: Tropicimonas isoalkanivorans gen. nov., sp. nov., a branched-alkane-degrading bacterium isolated from Semarang Port in Indonesia.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Tropicimonas (Tro.pi.ci.mo′nas. L. adj. tropicus tropical, pertaining to the tropical zone of the Earth; L. fem. n. monas unit, unicell; N.L. fem. n. Tropicimonas a unicell belonging to the tropical zone).
Cells are Gram-negative, motile by means of peritrichous flagella and rod-shaped (0.5–1.0 μm long and 0.3–0.5 μm wide).
Sodium ions are required for growth.
Form white colonies when grown on MA plates.
Quinone composition is Q-10 (57.4 %), Q-n1 (14.4 %) and Q-n2 (28.2 %).
Predominant fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c, C18 : 1ω9c and C16 : 0.
The type species is Tropicimonas isoalkanivorans.
